title: Missing semicolon
explanation: Missing semicolon at the end of statement `$x = 10`.

title: Variable prefix
explanation: Yes, all variables in PHP start with a dollar sign `$`.

title: Undefined constant usage
explanation: Constants are case-sensitive by default. `site` is undefined (interpreted as string 'site' in older PHP, warning in newer). Should be `SITE`.

title: Echo parenthesis
explanation: Yes, `echo` can be used with or without parentheses (it's a language construct).

title: Array syntax mismatch
explanation: Closing bracket mismatch. `[` requires `]`.

title: String concatenation
explanation: Yes, `.` is the string concatenation operator in PHP.

title: Foreach syntax
explanation: PHP uses `as`, not `in`. `foreach ($arr as $val)`.

title: Null check
explanation: Yes.

title: Function declaration
explanation: Keyword is `function`, not `fund`.

title: Superglobal GET
explanation: Yes, `$_GET` is a superglobal array.

title: Else if syntax
explanation: `elsif` is not valid PHP (valid in Perl/Ruby). PHP uses `elseif` or `else if`.

title: Increment operator
explanation: Yes.

title: Comparison operator
explanation: `=` is assignment. assigns 1 to $a, which is truthy. Likely meant `==`.

title: Comment style
explanation: Yes, PHP supports `#` (shell-style) comments as well as `//`.

title: Switch case break
explanation: Missing `break` after `case 1`. Will fallthrough to `case 2`, printing "OneTwo" if $x is 1. Usually unintentional.

title: Array push
explanation: Yes.

title: Unclosed string
explanation: Unclosed string literal.

title: Include function
explanation: Yes.

title: Print arrow arrow
explanation: `=>` is array key-value separator, not valid in print statement.

title: Global keyword
explanation: Yes, to access global variables inside function.

title: Variables in single quotes
explanation: Single quotes do not interpolate variables. Will output literal `$name`. Use double quotes for interpolation.

title: Explode string
explanation: Yes.

title: Function duplicate argument
explanation: Duplicate parameter name `$a`.

title: JSON encode
explanation: Yes.

title: Call undefined function
explanation: Fatal error: call to undefined function.

title: Associate array
explanation: Yes.

title: While loop condition
explanation: Missing parentheses around condition `($i < 10)`.

title: Strlen function
explanation: Yes.

title: Echo return value
explanation: `echo` is a language construct and has no return value (void). Cannot assign to `$res`.

title: Type hinting
explanation: Yes (PHP 7+).

title: Wrong not equals
explanation: `=!` is parsable as assignment `$a = (!$b)`. Not comparison `!=`.

title: Date function
explanation: Yes.

title: Require missing file
explanation: `require` emits Fatal Error if file not found (unlike `include` which emits Warning). Stops execution.

title: Var dump
explanation: Yes.

title: Class missing body
explanation: Missing closing brace `}`.

title: This keyword
explanation: Yes, inside class methods.

title: Private visibility outside
explanation: Cannot access private property `$x` from outside class.

title: New keyword
explanation: Yes.

title: Static method call
codeSnippet:
class C { static function f() {} }
C->f();
explanation: Static methods called with `::`, not `->`. `C::f()`.

title: Try catch
explanation: Yes.

title: Invalid array index
explanation: Undefined array key `5`. Emits Notice/Warning.

title: Die function
explanation: Yes, alias for `exit()`.

title: Constant assignment
explanation: Constants are immutable. Cannot be reassigned (and syntax implies it would be a variable `$C` but missing `$`? No, `C` is valid constant, assignment syntax invalid).

title: Unset function
explanation: Yes.

title: Dollar dollar var
explanation:
This works (variable variables). Not an error. 
Error: `$$a` undefined if `$a` undefined? 
Let's choose `invalid variable name` for error spotting. 
`$123 = "val";`

title: Invalid variable name
explanation: Variables cannot start with a number.

title: Header function
explanation: Yes.

title: PHP tag open
explanation: Short tag with space `<? php` is invalid (or interpreted as XML?). Standard tag is `<?php`. `<?` is short open tag (if enabled). `<? php` is usually treated as text.

title: Isset function
explanation: Yes.

title: Division by zero
explanation: Division by zero (Warning + Infinity or Fatal Error in PHP 8+).

title: Empty function
explanation: Yes.

title: Variable case sensitivity
explanation: Variables are case-sensitive in PHP. `$val` is undefined.

title: Count function
explanation: Yes.

title: Define syntax
explanation: `define` takes two arguments. `define("CONST", 1);`.

title: Implode function
explanation: Yes.

title: Function return missing value
explanation:
Function returns `NULL` implicitly. Not an error, but `$x` will be null. 
Error: `function f() { return 1 2; }`

title: Return duplicate value
explanation: Syntax error. Cannot return multiple values directly like this.

title: Null coalescing
explanation: Yes (PHP 7+).

title: Class property var
explanation:
`var` is old PHP 4 syntax. Standard is `public`, `protected`, `private`. (Technically `var` is equivalent to `public` in modern PHP, but deprecated/discouraged style). Code Reviewer flags it. 
Pure error: `public $x = time();` (expression assignment).

title: Property expression default
explanation: Class properties must be initialized with constant values, not expressions (unless compile-time constant). `1+1` is allowed in recent PHP? Yes (constant expression). `time()` is not.

title: In array
explanation: Yes.

title: Unclosed parenthesis
explanation: Missing closing parenthesis `)`.

title: Array key exists
explanation: Yes.

title: Extends multiple classes
explanation: PHP does not support multiple inheritance. Can only extend one class.

title: Interface implementation
explanation: Yes.

title: Interface method body
explanation: Interface methods cannot have a body.

title: Abstract class
explanation: Yes.

title: Object operator mismatch
explanation: PHP uses `->` for object access, not `.` (which is string concat).

title: Clone keyword
explanation: Yes.

title: Function default parameter order
explanation: Optional parameter `$a` before required parameter `$b` is deprecated (PHP 8 warning/error).

title: Foreach key value
explanation: Yes.

title: Echo array
explanation: Echoing an array prints "Array" (and Notice in newer PHP). Cannot dump content with echo.

title: Exit function
explanation: Yes.

title: Use statement position
explanation: `use` for namespaces/imports goes at top of file. `use` for traits goes inside class. `use OtherTrait` at global scope is invalid (unless it's import statement, but context implies trait usage). If import, valid.

title: Trait use outside class
explanation: Traits are used inside classes, not globally.

title: Namespace keyword
explanation: Yes.

title: Double arrow in assignment
explanation: `=>` is only for array definition or foreach. Assignment uses `=`.

title: Instanceof operator
explanation: Yes.

title: Access array with brace
explanation: Accessing array/string offset with braces `{}` is deprecated/removed in PHP 8. Use `[]`.

title: Empty string check
explanation: Yes, empty string is considered empty.

title: Foreach on int
explanation: Foreach expects array or object. Integer causes Warning/Error.

title: Static property access
explanation: Yes.

title: Construct function name
explanation: PHP 4 style constructors (same name as class) are deprecated/removed. Use `__construct()`.

title: Destruct method
explanation: Yes.

title: Unclosed comment
explanation: Unclosed multi-line comment.

title: Print r function
explanation: Yes.

title: Continue in if
explanation: `continue` only applies to loops. Syntax error if not inside loop (old PHP allowed it as break? No). Fatal Error.

title: Preg match
explanation: Yes.

title: Invalid heredoc
explanation: Closing identifier `EOT;` must not be indented (unless PHP 7.3+). Code Reviewer flags for compatibility usually. If strictly indented, it must match start indentation. Assuming standard issue.

title: File get contents
explanation: Yes.

title: Array merge null
explanation: `array_merge` expects arrays. `null` causes Warning/Error (PHP 7.4+).

title: Is numeric
explanation: Yes.

title: Call static as instance
codeSnippet:
class C { public function m() {} }
C::m();
explanation: Calling non-static method `m` statically is deprecated/error.

title: Ucfirst function
explanation: Yes.

title: Nested ternary associativity
explanation: Reference to PHP's unique left-associative ternary. It parses as `(1 ? 2 : 3) ? 4 : 5` -> `2 ? 4 : 5` -> 4. Most languages are right-associative (result 2). Deprecated in PHP 8 to require parens.

title: Setcookie
explanation: Yes.

title: Return in constructor
explanation: Constructor return value is ignored.

title: Spaceship operator
explanation: Yes (PHP 7+).

title: String index assign
explanation: Assigning string to string offset only takes first character. `$s` becomes "axc". "y" is lost. Warning might be emitted.

title: Strpos function
explanation: Yes.

title: Static var in global
explanation: `static` keyword for variables is for function scope (or class properties). Global scope `static` is invalid syntax (or useless?).

title: Declare strict types
explanation: Yes.

title: Invalid magic constant
explanation: Typo. `__FILE__` is the constant.

title: Require once
explanation: Yes.

title: Use of undefined constant
explanation: `key` is treated as a constant. If undefined, PHP falls back to string "key" but emits a Warning (PHP 8 throws Error likely or Warning). Should be quoted: `['key']`.

title: Static variable persistence
explanation: Yes, static variables persist between function calls.

title: Call by reference argument
explanation: Cannot pass literal `1` by reference. Must pass a variable.

title: Abstract class instantiation
explanation: Cannot instantiate abstract class.

title: Trait method collision
explanation: Collision: `f` exists in both traits. Must use `insteadof` or `as` to resolve.

title: Interface constant
explanation: Yes.

title: Reference assignment
explanation: Cannot assign reference to a literal.

title: Final class
codeSnippet: final class C {} class D extends C {}
explanation: Cannot extend final class.

title: Foreach modify value
explanation:
`$v` is a copy. `$arr` is not modified. Not an error, but common logic mistake. 
Error: `foreach ($arr as &$v)` is correct way. 
Let's choose `break` outside loop.

title: Break argument
explanation: `break` argument must be positive integer (levels to break). 0 is invalid.

title: Magic method get
explanation: Yes.

title: Static method access non-static
explanation: Cannot use `$this` in static method.

title: Anonymous class
explanation: Yes (PHP 7+).

title: Array access on object
explanation: Cannot use object as array unless it implements `ArrayAccess`. `stdClass` does not.

title: Yield keyword
explanation: Yes.

title: Duplicate property
explanation: Cannot redeclare property `$x`.

title: Callable type hint
explanation: Yes.

title: Const arrays (old PHP)
explanation:
Valid in PHP 5.6+. 
Error: `define('ARR', [1]);` valid in 7.0+. 
Let's choose `private const` outside class.

title: Private const global
explanation: Visibility modifiers (`private`, `public`) not allowed for global constants. Only class constants.

title: Namespace alias
explanation: Yes.

title: Constructor return type
explanation:
Valid in PHP? Yes, standard is no return type, but `: void` is allowed/encouraged recently. 
Error: `: int` for destruct/construct.

title: Destructor return type
explanation: Destructor cannot define return type (implicitly void).

title: Variadic arguments
explanation: Yes (PHP 5.6+).

title: String interpolation array key
explanation: Quoted keys in simple variable interpolation inside string cause parse error. Use `{$arr['key']}` or `$arr[key]` (bad practice). Correct: curly braces.

title: Nullsafe operator
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Illegal offset type
explanation: Objects cannot be used as array keys. Illegal offset type Fatal Error (or Warning).

title: Void return type
explanation: Yes (PHP 7.1+).

title: Switch continue 2
explanation:
Valid syntax (targets loop). 
Error: `continue` in switch targeting switch? Acts like break. Warning in PHP 7.3. 
Let's choose `break` in `if`.

title: Public constant visibility
explanation: `public` modifier only allowed inside class. Global constants via `const` or `define`.

title: Class constant access
explanation: Yes.

title: Function redefinition
explanation: Fatal error: Cannot redeclare f().

title: Goto statement
explanation: Yes (PHP 5.3+).

title: Parent construct call
explanation:
Not strict error, but child constructor overrides parent. Parent constructor not called unless explicitly called. Logic bug often. 
Error: `parent::f()` when no parent?

title: Parent call no parent
explanation: Class `C` has no parent. Cannot call `parent::`.

title: Arrow functions
explanation: Yes (PHP 7.4+).

title: Interface property
explanation: Interfaces cannot contain properties.

title: Array dereferencing
explanation: Yes.

title: This in static var closure
explanation: Closure defined in static method. `$this` is not available inside it (unless bound, but here captured from static scope which checks `this`).

title: Iterable type
explanation: Yes (PHP 7.1+).

title: Abstract private method
explanation: Abstract methods cannot be private (must be implemented by child, child cannot access private).

title: Weak reference
explanation: Yes (PHP 7.4+).

title: Bitwise shift string
explanation:
PHP casts string to int. Valid: `1 << 1` -> 2. 
Error: `yield` outside function.

title: Yield outside function
explanation: `yield` can only be used inside a function.

title: Finally block
explanation: Yes.

title: Non-compound namespace name
explanation:
Using standard identifiers like `PHP` as top-level namespace is discouraged? Actually it is valid syntax. 
Error: `namespace` must be first statement.

title: Namespace after code
explanation: `namespace` declaration must be the very first statement in the script (except declare).

title: Echo short tag
explanation: Yes, always enabled since PHP 5.4.

title: Invalid argument count
explanation: Missing argument 1 for `f`. Warning then Error (PHP 8).

title: Closure bind
explanation: Yes.

title: Dynamic class constant
explanation:
Valid in newer PHP (5.3+). 
Error: `echo $c::$const` if property? 
Error: Accessing `parent::` outside class.

title: Parent keyword usage
explanation: `parent` cannot be used outside of a class context.

title: Self keyword
explanation: Yes.

title: Uncaught exception
explanation: Fatal error: Uncaught Exception.

title: Mixed return type
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Clone closure
explanation:
Closures cannot be cloned? Actually they CAN be cloned in PHP. 
Error: `clone 1`.

title: Clone non-object
explanation: `__clone` method called on non-object (fatal error).

title: Final method
explanation: Yes, prevents overriding.

title: Reference in math
explanation: Call-time pass-by-reference syntax `&` in expressions is undefined/syntax error.

title: Dir magic constant
explanation: Yes.

title: Unserialize untrusted
explanation: Unserializing untrusted data can lead to Object Injection vulnerabilities. Use `json_decode` or signed data.

title: Magic constant line
explanation: Yes.

title: Preg replace eval
explanation: `search` modifier `e` (eval) is deprecated and removed in PHP 7. Use `preg_replace_callback`.

title: Array filter
explanation: Yes.

title: Use of deleted variable
explanation: Undefined variable `$var` (Warning).

title: Compact function
explanation: Yes.

title: Global keyword in method
explanation:
Valid syntax. Bad practice mostly. 
Error: `global $this;`.

title: Global this
explanation: Cannot re-assign `$this` or declare it global. Fatal error.

title: Extract function
explanation: Yes.

title: Yield from non-generator
explanation:
`yield from` is valid inside generator. 
Error: `yield return` (C# syntax).

title: Yield return syntax
explanation: `yield return` is invalid syntax. Use `yield 1;`.

title: Is scalar
explanation: Yes.

title: Foreach list destructuring key
explanation:
Valid in PHP 5.5+. 
Error: `foreach ($arr as $k => list($a))` valid? Yes. 
Error: `list()` left side of assignment `list($a) = $arr` valid. 
Let's choose `list` with insufficient elements? No runtime. 
Error: `list($a, $b) = 1;` (assign scalar).

title: List assign scalar
explanation: Cannot assign scalar to `list()` (Fatal error or Warning depending on version).

title: Magic invoke
explanation: Yes, if class has `__invoke` method.

title: New object parenthesis
explanation:
Valid (optional parentheses). Code Reviewer might flag for consistency. 
Error: `new $var` when var is not class name? No (valid). 
Error: `new Class[]` (Java syntax).

title: Java array instantiation
explanation: PHP does not use `new Class[N]` for arrays. Use `array()` or `[]`.

title: Call user func
explanation: Yes.

title: Multi-catch syntax
explanation:
Valid in PHP 7.1+. 
Error: `catch (E1, E2 $e)` (comma separator).

title: Catch comma separator
explanation: Multi-catch uses `|`, not `,`.

title: Static method late binding
explanation: Yes.

title: Invalid property name
explanation: Property names cannot start with a number.

title: Array splice
explanation: Yes.

title: Echo undefined index
explanation: `@` suppresses error. Strictly not an error (suppressed). Code Reviewer: avoid `@` operator (silence operator).

title: Constants as class props
explanation: Yes.

title: Method without visibility
explanation:
Default is public. Not an error. 
Error: `abstract final class` (contradiction).

title: Abstract final class
explanation: Class cannot be both abstract (must be extended) and final (cannot be extended).

title: Magic sleep
explanation: Yes.

title: Non-static method call context
codeSnippet:
class A { function f() { echo $this->x; } }
A::f();
explanation: Accessing `$this` in non-static method called statically creates fatal error.

title: Json decode array
explanation: Yes, returns associative array instead of object.

title: Private constructor instantiation
codeSnippet:
class C { private function __construct() {} }
$c = new C();
explanation: Cannot call private constructor from global scope.

title: Mysqli construct
explanation: Yes.

title: Interface method implementation mismatch
codeSnippet:
interface I { function f($a); }
class C implements I { function f() {} }
explanation: Implementation must match signature. Missing parameter `$a`. Fatal error.

title: Closure bindTo scope
explanation: Yes.

title: String to array conversion
explanation: Appending to string using `[]` operator throws Fatal Error (before PHP 7.1 it was quiet?). In modern PHP: Fatal Error: [] operator not supported for strings.

title: Echo heredoc
explanation: Yes (if indented correctly 7.3+ or unindented).

title: Namespace resolution
explanation:
Valid (Global C). 
Error: `new A\C` inside `A\B` looks for `A\B\A\C`. 
Error: `use function` syntax mismatch.

title: Use function syntax
explanation:
Valid in PHP 5.6+. 
Error: `use A\{f, g};` (group use) without function keyword? Valid for classes. 
Let's choose `function f` inside `if` without braces? No. 
Error: `abstract` property.

title: Abstract property
explanation: Properties cannot be declared abstract.

title: Array map
explanation: Yes.

title: Unmatching encoding
codeSnippet:
header('Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8');
// File saved as ISO-8859-1
explanation: Header declares UTF-8 but file encoding mismatch will cause display issues. (Not syntax error, but logic/config).

title: Hash equals
explanation: Yes (timing attack safe string comparison).

title: Global goto specific
explanation: Cannot jump into a function (or out of one) using goto. Label must be in same scope.

title: PDO connection
explanation: Yes.

title: Array spread in old PHP
explanation:
Spread operator for arrays required PHP 7.4+. Valid now. 
Error: `...$b` in associative array with string keys? (PHP 8.1 support). 
Error: `unset($this)`.

title: Unset this
explanation: Cannot unset `$this`.

title: Mbstring length
explanation: Yes.

title: Var dump return
explanation:
`var_dump` outputs directly and returns void. Echoing void prints nothing (or empty). Not strictly error but redundant/wrong usage. 
Error: `print` returns 1, `echo` returns void. `echo echo 1;` syntax error.

title: Echo inception
explanation: Syntax error.

title: Basename function
explanation: Yes.

title: Static method arrow
explanation:
Calling static method as instance method is technically valid in PHP (Warning/Notice depending on version) but bad practice. `C::f()` preferred. 
Strict Error: `final const` (Allowed 8.1). 
Error: `trait` extending class.

title: Trait inheritance
explanation: Traits cannot extend classes or other traits (can `use` other traits).

title: Dirname function
explanation: Yes.

title: Multiple visibility modifiers
explanation: Cannot have multiple visibility modifiers.

title: Error reporting
explanation: Yes.

title: Function default expression
explanation: Constant expressions allowed in PHP 5.6+. `function f($a = time())` is invalid.

title: Default value dynamic
explanation: Default value must be a constant expression, not a variable.

title: Set exception handler
explanation: Yes.

title: Namespace braces mix
explanation: Cannot mix bracketed and unbracketed namespace declarations in same file.

title: Ini set
explanation: Yes.

title: Empty try block
explanation:
Not an error, but Useless. 
Error: `try` without `catch` or `finally`.

title: Try without handlers
explanation: A `try` block must be followed by at least one `catch` or `finally` block.

title: Preg split
explanation: Yes.

title: Reference count memory leak
explanation: Circular reference in array `$a`. `unset($a)` removes the symbol but the memory is not freed immediately (until GC cycle). Not strict error but advanced memory concept.

title: Filter var validate email
explanation: Yes.

title: Generator return value access
explanation: Cannot get return value of a generator that hasn't finished iterating. Throws Exception.

title: SplFixedArray
explanation: Yes.

title: Clone private method
explanation: Cannot access private `__clone` method. Clone restricted.

title: ReflectionClass
explanation: Yes.

title: Destruct during exception
codeSnippet:
class C { function __destruct() { throw new Exception(); } }
// script end
explanation: Throwing exception from destructor during script shutdown causes Fatal Error.

title: Exception in destructor
codeSnippet: class C { public function __destruct() { throw new E(); } }
explanation: Throwing exception in destructor during script shutdown results in Fatal Error.

title: Anonymous function binding
explanation: Yes.

title: Trait static property collision
codeSnippet:
trait T { public static $x = 1; }
class C { use T; public static $x = 2; }
explanation: Trait and Class defining same property name (static or not) must match visibility and initial value (strict compatibility). Since values differ (1 vs 2), Fatal Error.

title: IntlDateFormatter
explanation: Yes.

title: Unset string offset
explanation: Cannot unset string offsets. Fatal error.

title: Argument unpacking
explanation: Yes.

title: Invalid callable array
explanation: Method 'm' does not exist on stdClass. Runtime error when invoking or checking `is_callable`.

title: Array change key case
explanation: Yes.

title: Static closure bind attempt
explanation: Cannot bind an object to a static closure. Method returns explicit warning or fails.

title: Closure bind object
explanation: Yes.

title: Goto loop initialization
explanation: Cannot jump into loop structure. Loop variable `$i` might be uninitialized (but specifically, jumping into loop is forbidden).

title: Serialize object
explanation: Yes.

title: Covariant return types violation
codeSnippet:
class P { function f(): array {} }
class C extends P { function f(): iterable {} }
explanation: Return type must be covariant (narrower or same). `iterable` is wider than `array`. Invalid override.

title: Attributes
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Contravariant parameter type violation
codeSnippet:
class P { function f(stdClass $o) {} }
class C extends P { function f(Object $o) {} }
explanation:
Parameter types must be contravariant (wider or same). `Object` is not a valid type in older PHPs, but assuming `object` (primitive), `object` is wider than `stdClass`, so this is VALID (contravariance allowed in 7.4+). 
Wait. 
P: accepts stdClass (Specific). 
C expects Object (Wider). 
Caller of C treated as P passes stdClass. C handles it. Valid. 
Inversion: P: f(object). C: f(stdClass). Invalid. 
Let's assume the question meant invalid direction.

title: Covariant parameter
codeSnippet:
class P { function f(object $o) {} }
class C extends P { function f(stdClass $o) {} }
explanation: Parameter types must be contravariant (wider). `stdClass` is narrower than `object`. Invalid override.

title: Match expression
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Readonly property write
codeSnippet:
class C { public readonly int $x; }
$c = new C; $c->x = 2; $c->x = 3;
explanation: Readonly property can only be initialized once. Re-assignment throws Error.

title: Fibers
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: Enum inheritance
codeSnippet:
enum E {}
class C extends E {}
explanation: Enums are final and cannot be extended.

title: Intersection types
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: Final private method
codeSnippet: class C { final private function f() {} }
explanation: `final` on `private` method is redundant/warning (since 8.0) because private methods cannot be overridden anyway unless extended class re-declares them (shadows). Warning emitted.

title: SplObjectStorage
explanation: Yes.

title: Non-capturing catch variable
explanation:
Valid in PHP 8.0+. Before that, required variable `$e`. If looking for PHP 7 error, this is it. 
Assume modern PHP. 
Error: `abstract` function in trait? (Valid). 
Error: `interface` extends class.

title: Interface extending class
explanation: Interface cannot extend a class. Only other interfaces.

title: Anonymous class extends
explanation: Yes.

title: Nested attribute syntax
explanation:
Nested attributes using `new` is allowed in 8.1. 
Error: `#[Attr] function f() {}` valid? Yes. 
Error: `#[Attr]` on else? 
Code: `if (1) #[Attr] {}`

title: Attribute location
explanation: Attributes cannot be placed on blocks/statements inside code. Only classes, functions, properties, params, constants.

title: Named arguments
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Promoted property in non-constructor
explanation: Constructor property promotion only allowed in `__construct`.

title: Union types
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Never return type return
explanation: `never` return type means function must exit/throw/infinite loop. Cannot return (even null).

title: Enums backed
explanation: Yes (Backed Enum).

title: Variadic by reference default
explanation: Variadic arguments cannot have default value (always array).

title: Disjunctive normal form types
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+ DNF types).

title: Enum property
explanation: Enums cannot have state (properties).

title: SensitiveParameter
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Readonly class dynamic prop
explanation: Readonly classes cannot have dynamic (untyped/undeclared) properties.

title: Constants in traits
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Static variable constant expression violation
explanation:
Static variable default must be value/constant expression. `new` is allowed in PHP 8.1? No, `new` in static variable initializer allowed in 8.3? Or property? 
In < 8.3: invalid. In 8.3: Valid. 
Let's assume standard modern PHP < 8.3: Error. 
But safe bet for error: `static $x = func_call();`

title: Static var dynamic default
explanation: Static variables must be initialized with constant expressions (not function calls).

title: Trait method visibility override
explanation: Yes.

title: Yield in constructor
explanation: Constructor returning a Generator (via yield) is technically valid but the object instance is NOT returned (the generator is discared). `$c = new C` returns instance, not generator. Effectively confusing/wrong.

title: Yield from non-iterable
explanation: `yield from` requires an iterable (array or Traversable). Integer is invalid.

title: Final class constant
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: Global use
explanation: Traits (`use T`) can only be used inside classes, not functions.

title: New in initializer
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: Self in global
explanation: `self` only valid inside class scope.

title: Null safe method call
explanation: Yes.

title: Use of deprecated dynamic property
explanation: Dynamic properties are deprecated in PHP 8.2 unless class marked with `#[AllowDynamicProperties]` or inherits from stdClass. Emits Deprecated notice.

title: Assert throw
explanation: Yes, if configured to throw AssertionError (default in some configs/versions).

title: Static method late binding recursion
codeSnippet:
class A { static function f() { static::f(); } }
A::f();
explanation: Infinite recursion stack overflow.

title: Combaits trait precedence
codeSnippet: class C { use T; function f() {} } // f overrides T::f
explanation: Yes, class methods override trait methods.

title: Readonly class modification
codeSnippet:
readonly class C { public $x; }
class D extends C { public $y; }
explanation:
Readonly classes can only point to readonly classes? No, they are final? No. 
Actually, extended class from readonly class must also be readonly.

title: Global strict types
explanation: Yes, but strictly per-file. It doesn't affect included files. False? The statement is valid code.

title: Utf8 encode deprecated
explanation: `utf8_encode` and `utf8_decode` are deprecated in PHP 8.2. Use `mb_convert_encoding`.

title: Resource type hint
explanation: `resource` is not a valid type declaration/hint in PHP (historically not supported, though is scalar type, `is_resource` works).

title: Yield from array key handling
explanation:
Duplicate keys in array literal will result in overwrite before yield. Not error, but logic. 
Error: `namespace` nested.

title: Nested namespace
explanation: Nested namespaces are not allowed.

title: Trait abstract method
explanation: Yes, requires user class to implement it.

title: Interface constant override
codeSnippet:
interface I { const A = 1; }
class C implements I { const A = 2; }
explanation: Interface constants cannot be overridden (before PHP 8.1?). In 8.1+ they can be if final/invariance rules met. `1` vs `2` is different value. Fatal error.

title: Static closure scope
explanation: Static closures do not have `this`, but `static::`? `static` keyword inside static closure refers to scope where defined? Actually `static::class` usually works in context unless no class. But `static` closure prevents binding. Is it correct syntax? Yes.

title: Callable type property
explanation: `callable` cannot be used as a property type.

title: New in default param
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: Never return with value
explanation:
Correct usage. 
Error: `function f(): never { return; }`. Done earlier. 
Error: `false` return type returns true.

title: False return type violations
explanation: Function declares return type `false` but returns `true`. TypeError.

title: True return type
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Readonly class inheritance
codeSnippet:
class C {} 
readonly class D extends C {}
explanation: Readonly class can only extend readonly class (or nothing/stdClass?). Actually: Readonly class extending non-readonly class is Valid? NO. Readonly classes cannot extend non-readonly classes.

title: Array is list
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: Unpacking associative array
explanation:
Unpacking associative arrays works (named arguments) in PHP 8.0+. 
Wait. 
Is there a case where it errors? Unpacking numeric keys? No. 
Old PHP (<8.0) error. 
Assume modern. 
Error: `enum` implements class? (Enums implement interfaces).

title: Enum implements class
explanation: `implements` is for interfaces. Cannot implement a class.

title: Null type
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Dynamic constant define
explanation: `const` requires constant expression. `$var` is runtime variable. Use `define`.

title: Trait constants visibility
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Static Variable Scope Leak
explanation: Static variable `$x` is local to function `f`. Undefined in global.

title: Pure intersection types
explanation: Yes.

title: Invalid enum case value
explanation: Enum backed by `int` cannot have float value `1.5`.

title: Allow dynamic properties attr
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Disallowed callable call
explanation: Calling `self::method` etc, via string is deprecated/removed for certain relative keywords contextually if not in class? Actually deprecated in 8.2 as 'partially supported callable'.

title: Readonly classes
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Intersection of scalar
explanation: Intersection types cannot include scalar types (only class types/interfaces). `int` & `string` implies impossibility anyway.

title: Foreach by ref
explanation: Yes.

title: Clone readonly property
codeSnippet:
readonly class C { public $x; }
$c = new C; clone $c;
explanation:
Cloning readonly class works. But if you try to `__clone` and unset property to re-set it? 
Error: `final` trait.

title: Final trait
explanation: Traits cannot be declared final.

title: Enum methods
explanation: Yes.

title: Yield from generator return
codeSnippet:
function g() { return 1; }
function f() { yield from g(); }
explanation: `yield from` expects a generator/iterable. A function returning 1 (int) is not iterable. `g()` is regular function not generator (no yield inside).

title: Never type
explanation: Yes.

title: Match duplicate default
explanation: Match expression cannot have multiple default cases.

title: Json validate
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.3+).

title: Abstract class instantiation reflex
explanation: Cannot instantiate abstract class even via Reflection. Throws Exception.

title: Randomizer class
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.2+).

title: Override attribute mismatch
codeSnippet:
class P { function f() {} }
class C extends P { #[Override] function g() {} }
explanation: `#[Override]` attribute asserts the method overrides a parent method. `g` does not exist in `P`. Fatal Error.

title: SplInt
explanation: SplInt is part of SPL Types extension (PECL), not standard PHP core.

title: Enum duplicate case value
codeSnippet: enum E: int { case A = 1; case B = 1; }
explanation: Enum cases in backed enum must be unique. Duplicate value `1`.

title: WeakMap
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Increment bool
explanation: Incrementing bool has no effect (deprecated in 8.3, emits warning).

title: Readonly property
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.1+).

title: String increment alphanumeric
explanation:
PHP supports Perl-style string increment. "2d9"++ -> "2e0". 
Error: Decrement string? 
Code: `$s--;`

title: String decrement
explanation: PHP does not support string decrementing. Has no effect or not supported.

title: Str contains
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Class alias loop
explanation: Cannot redeclare class A (if it exists). If neither exists, `class_alias` fails because source undefined? `class_alias` first arg must be existing class/interface.

title: Get debug type
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+).

title: Isset on constant
explanation: `isset` only works on variables/array elements/properties. Constants are not valid arguments.

title: Fdiv function
explanation: Yes (PHP 8.0+), performs float division (IEEE 754) returning Inf/NaN instead of error.
